parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
Glory, fame, praise; rumor, report, credit. From a shorter form of kaleo; renown.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To strike with the fist, buffet; hence: I mistreat violently. From a derivative of the base of kolazo; to rap with the fist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To do that which is good. From agathopoios; to be a well-doer.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
